question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What position did Igor López de Munain hold in 2035?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1: In the heart of the Basque Country, a region nestled in the northernmost part of Spain, a dedicated politician has been making waves in the world of Basque politics. Igor López de Munain, a name synonymous with dedication and public service, has been a stalwart figure in the Basque Parliament. As we delve into the life and career of this remarkable individual, it becomes clear that he indeed holds the esteemed position of deputy of the Basque Parliament. Born and raised in the Basque Country, Igor López de Munain was instilled with a deep sense of pride and responsibility towards his community from a young age. As he grew older, his passion for politics and public service only intensified, driving him to pursue a career that would allow him to make a meaningful impact on the lives of his fellow Basques. Igor's journey into politics began with his involvement in various local organizations and advocacy groups, where he worked tirelessly to promote the interests of the Basque people. His dedication and natural leadership abilities quickly earned him recognition, and he soon found himself at the forefront of the Basque political scene. In 2012, Igor López de Munain took a significant step forward in his political career when he was elected as a member of the Basque Parliament. This milestone marked the beginning of a new chapter in his life, as he became an integral part of the legislative body responsible for shaping the future of the Basque Country. As a deputy of the Basque Parliament, Igor has been an outspoken advocate for the rights and interests of the Basque people. He has worked closely with his fellow parliamentarians to draft and pass legislation that benefits the region, focusing on issues such as economic development, education, and cultural preservation. One of Igor's most notable achievements during his tenure as a deputy has been his role in promoting the Basque language, Euskara. Recognizing the importance of preserving the region's unique cultural heritage, Igor has been instrumental in pushing for policies that support the use of Euskara in public institutions and promote its teaching in schools. Igor's commitment to the Basque people has not gone unnoticed. In 2016, he was re-elected to the Basque Parliament, a testament to the trust and confidence that his constituents have in him. His re-election was a clear indication that his work was having a tangible impact on the lives of the people he represented.
content.source_2:
Igor López de Munain

Igor López de Munain (born 1964) is a Basque politician and Catholic bishop who served as the diocesan bishop of the Diocese of Bilbao from 2031 to 2040. Early Life and Education

López de Munain was born in Bilbao, Spain, on August 12, 1964. He was raised in a devout Catholic family and was drawn to the priesthood from a young age. He pursued his seminary studies at the Pontifical University of Comillas, where he earned a degree in theology in 1989. Priesthood and Early Career

López de Munain was ordained as a priest on June 29, 1991, by Bishop Luis María Larrea. He served as a parish priest in several parishes in the Diocese of Bilbao, including the Cathedral of St. James in Bilbao. During this time, he became known for his strong advocacy for social justice and his commitment to interfaith dialogue. Rise to Episcopacy

In 2025, López de Munain was appointed as the auxiliary bishop of the Diocese of Bilbao by Pope Francis. He was consecrated as a bishop on October 12, 2025, by Bishop Mario Iceta. Diocesan Bishop of Bilbao (2031-2040)

On January 15, 2031, López de Munain was appointed as the diocesan bishop of the Diocese of Bilbao, succeeding Bishop Mario Iceta. During his tenure, he focused on promoting ecumenism and interfaith dialogue, as well as addressing the social and economic challenges facing the Basque region. Under his leadership, the Diocese of Bilbao established several programs aimed at promoting social justice, including a refugee resettlement program and a initiative to combat human trafficking. He also played a key role in the development of the Basque Peace Process, a initiative aimed at promoting reconciliation and peace in the region. López de Munain was also a strong advocate for environmental protection and was instrumental in the development of the Diocese of Bilbao's environmental policy. He was a vocal critic of climate change and its impact on the poor and vulnerable. Resignation and Later Life

On December 31, 2040, López de Munain resigned as diocesan bishop of the Diocese of Bilbao, citing health reasons. He was succeeded by Bishop Juan Carlos Elizalde.

answer: Diocesan bishop of the Diocese of Bilbao
